item.title: Fyrmanz add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Fyrmanz add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Fyrmanz add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "In a good bookroom you feel in some mysterious way that you are absorbing the wisdom contained in all the books through your skin, without even opening them." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Fyrmanz add a quote by Confucious
item.description: "By three methods we may learn wisdom: First, by reflection, which is noblest; Second, by imitation, which is easiest; and third by experience, which is the bitterest." -- Confucious

item.title: Fyrmanz add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Don't walk behind me; I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me; I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Fyrmanz add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Fyrmanz add a quote by Buddha Siddhartha Guatama Shakyamuni
item.description: "There is nothing more dreadful than the habit of doubt. Doubt separates people. It is a poison that disintegrates friendships and breaks up pleasant relations. It is a thorn that irritates and hurts; it is a sword that kills." -- Buddha Siddhartha Guatama Shakyamuni

item.title: Fyrmanz add a quote by Henri Nouwen
item.description: "When we honestly ask ourselves which person in our lives mean the most to us, we often find that it is those who, instead of giving advice, solutions, or cures, have chosen rather to share our pain and touch our wounds with a warm and tender hand. The friend who can be silent with us in a moment of despair or confusion, who can stay with us in an hour of grief and bereavement, who can tolerate not knowing, not curing, not healing and face with us the reality of our powerlessness, that is a friend who cares." -- Henri Nouwen

item.title: Fyrmanz add a quote by Kahlil Gibran
item.description: "No human relation gives one possession in anotherâ€”every two souls are absolutely different. In friendship or in love, the two side by side raise hands together to find what one cannot reach alone." -- Kahlil Gibran

item.title: Fyrmanz add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Friendship is certainly the finest balm for the pangs of disappointed love." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Fyrmanz add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is unnecessary, like philosophy, like art.... It has no survival value; rather it is one of those things which give value to survival." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Fyrmanz add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Is it so bad, then, to be misunderstood? Pythagoras was misunderstood, and Socrates, and Jesus, and Luther, and Copernicus, and Galileo, and Newton, and every pure and wise spirit that ever took flesh. To be great is to be misunderstood." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Fyrmanz add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "Therefore do not worry about tomorrow, for tomorrow will worry about its own things. Sufficient for the day is its own trouble. Matthew 6:34" -- Anonymous

item.title: Fyrmanz add a quote by Blaise Pascal
item.description: "To make light of philosophy is to be a true philosopher." -- Blaise Pascal

item.title: Fyrmanz add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "You shall know the truth, and the truth shall make you free" -- Anonymous
